title: Corrie star Kym Marsh shares heartbreaking tribute to her 'angel baby'
text:
Coronation Street’s Kym Marsh calls to end miscarriage taboo (Picture: Getty Images)

Coronation Street star Kym Marsh has called to end the taboo surrounding miscarriages in a heartbreaking tribute to her ‘angel baby’.

The actress tragically lost her son, Archie, back in February 2009, after he arrived 18 weeks premature.

And now she has paid tribute to the tot, who she shares with ex-husband Jamie Lomas, 10 years after his death.

Taking to Instagram, the 43-year-old posted a picture of a candle with her son’s name written across the front, next to a stone angel.

Alongside the snap, she wrote to her 289,000 followers: ‘Today we remember all of those babies who became angels far too soon, and all of the parents whose hearts remain broken.

She paid a heartbreaking tribute to her ‘angel baby’ (Picture: Kym Marsh / Instagram)

‘I am one of those parents. I am a mummy to an angel baby and I am forever grateful to have had him in my life no matter how short a time.’

The star then shared: ‘Let’s stand together, lift the taboo and break the silence of babyloss. Sending love to all #babylossawarenessday.’

Fans were quick to comment, where they flooded the soapie with love.

‘Lots of love to you xxx I have an angel baby boy as well,’ one wrote while another added: ‘Sending loads of love gorgeous.’

Kym recently became a grandmother when her daughter Emilie gave birth (Picture: WireImage)

Someone else said: ‘Sending all my love to you at this time and always remember.’

Kym has another three children: 22-year-old Emilie Mae Cunliffe, eight-year-old Polly Lomas and 24-year-old David Ryan Cunliffe.

Just this year, she also became a grandmother for the first time after Emilie gave birth to a baby boy with her boyfriend of two years, Mikey Hoszowskyj.

Sharing the news at the time, Kym wrote: ‘Last night was a night I will never forget. I became a “Loli” for the first time!!!

‘My beautiful daughter was an absolute warrior and her partner and I were the best birthing team we could be!!! I was so honoured to have been a part of bringing him into the world.

‘My beautiful grandson, I love you I will always love you and I promise to help guide you through life as best I can. Welcome to the world “Baby Hoz” #name to follow.’

description: Coronation Street's Kym Marsh calls to end miscarriage taboo in heartbreaking tribute to her 'angel baby'.
